item.title: Mary add a quote by S. Weir Mitchell
item.description: "Show me the books he loves and I shall know the man far better than through mortal friends." -- S. Weir Mitchell

item.title: Mary add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Mary add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Mary add a quote by Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra
item.description: "Finally, from so little sleeping and so much reading, his brain dried up and he went completely out of his mind." -- Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra

item.title: Mary add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Part of the secret of success in life is to eat what you like and let the food fight it out inside." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Mary add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Eating and reading are two pleasures that combine admirably." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Mary add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "You can't just turn on creativity like a faucet. You have to be in the right mood. What mood is that? Last-minute panic." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Mary add a quote by Judy Schachner
item.description: "My ears are too beeg for my head. My head ees too beeg for my body. I am not a Siamese cat ... I AM A CHIHUAHUA!" <i>-- Skippyjon Jones (In his very best Spanish accent)</i>" -- Judy Schachner

item.title: Mary add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "When beetles fight these battles in a bottle with their paddles and the bottle's on a poodle and the poodle's eating noodles... ...they call this a muddle puddle tweetle poodle beetle noodle bottle paddle battle." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Mary add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Mary add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Mary add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Mary add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Mary add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Give a man a fire and he's warm for a day, but set fire to him and he's warm for the rest of his life." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Mary add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "We are not necessarily doubting that God will do the best for us; we are wondering how painful the best will turn out to be." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Mary add a quote by Stéphane Mallarmé
item.description: "Everything in the world exists in order to end up as a book." -- Stéphane Mallarmé

item.title: Mary add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Mary add a quote by Saul Bellow
item.description: "People can lose their lives in libraries. They ought to be warned." -- Saul Bellow

item.title: Mary add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Classic' - a book which people praise and don't read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Mary add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "The Christian does not think God will love us because we are good, but that God will make us good because He loves us." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Mary add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "If we find ourselves with a desire that nothing in this world can satisfy, the most probable explanation is that we were made for another world." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Mary add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "Cultivate an attitude of happiness. Cultivate a spirit of optimism. Walk with faith, rejoicing in the beauties of nature, in the goodness of those you love, in the testimony which you carry in your heart concerning things divine." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Mary add a quote by Mel Odom
item.description: "Secrets are such hard things to manage whwn you're not the only one who knows." -- Mel Odom

item.title: Mary add a quote by Brandon Sanderson
item.description: "Personally, I like it much better when someone else does the decision making. That way you have legitimate grounds to whine and complain. I tend to find both whining and complaining quite interesting and amusing, though sometimes--unfortunately--it's hard to choose which one of the two I want to do. Sigh. LIfe can be so tough sometimes." -- Brandon Sanderson

item.title: Mary add a quote by Brandon Sanderson
item.description:
"You see, that is the sad, sorry, terrible thing about sarcasm.
It's really funny." -- Brandon Sanderson

item.title: Mary add a quote by Augusten Burroughs
item.description: "Like cubic zirconia, I only look real. I'm an imposter. The fact is, I am not like other people." -- Augusten Burroughs

item.title: Mary add a quote by Augusten Burroughs
item.description: "Some damage is too severe, some harm endures. And what you have to do is accept it. And by accept it I mean, don’t be the paralyzed person in the bed who is waiting to walk again. Realize, it’s never gonna happen. And find some other way to get around –swing from a vine, get a Mad Max wheelchair. Anything but…wait." -- Augusten Burroughs

item.title: Mary add a quote by Max Lucado
item.description: "A woman's heart should be so hidden in God that a man has to seek Him just to find her." -- Max Lucado

item.title: Mary add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "but for my own part, if a book is well written, I always find it too short." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Mary add a quote by Anne Fadiman
item.description: "I have never been able to resist a book about books." -- Anne Fadiman
